result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Joseph Kremer-Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AODA and follow through deemed by agent.
DNA Sample ordered but already provided.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Joseph Kremer-Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Aaron Joseph Kremer-Allen in court and in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:32 am. State gives plea agreement, DRI ct's 2 & 3 & plea to ct 1, withheld sentence 1 year, costs DNA surcharge, AODA and follow through.  Atty Laufenberg and def. agree with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights.  Def. understands charge and penalties.  Ct 1 Possession of THC, no contest plea, DRI Ct's 2 & 3. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accept plea and finds def. Guilty to Poss of THC in ct 1.  State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing recommendation.  9 days credit if revoked.  Bond can be applied to costs. Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders on ct 1 - withheld jail sentence 1 year probation, costs, $200 DNA Surcharge AODA and follow through deemed by agent. 9 days credit if revoked. State provides information from jail DNA Sample already provided.   Bond applied and balance returned to poster. Financial obligation pd so no need to read paragraph. Def. advised of postconviction rights.
Ad Prosecuendum and Order to Institution

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 2:22 pm.  Def. is in custody @ Oconto Co.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:25 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Will set for tentative plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron Joseph Kremer-Allen

Defendant Aaron Joseph Kremer-Allen in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Special appearance.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will received not guilty pleas.  Bond set by court  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
